thread.title: Obama won't seek stay for immigration ruling from Supreme Court
thread.title_full: Obama won't seek stay for immigration ruling from Supreme Court

author: Jordan Fabian
title: Obama won't seek stay for immigration ruling from Supreme Court
text: Justice Dept. won't seek stay for immigration ruling By Jordan Fabian - 05/27/15 04:29 PM EDT The Department of Justice said Wednesday it will not make an emergency request to the Supreme Court to lift an order blocking President Obama's immigration program. Instead, it will focus on the appeal of the injunction itself at the Fifth Circuit, which is expected to proceed in July. "The Department has determined that it will not seek a stay from the Supreme Court," Justice Department spokesman Patrick Rodenbush said. ADVERTISEMENT Rodenbush said the "best way" to win the case is "to focus on the ongoing appeal on the merits of the preliminary injunction itself. That appeal has been proceeding on an expedited basis, and the Fifth Circuit is expected to hear argument the week of July 6." Past: 1 day Report: Obama lied about bin Laden...
